Portuguese under Minimalist Formal Lenses
Cilene Rodrigues, Vitor NÃ³brega, Marcus Lunguinho
February 2023
 

With a minimalist outlook in mind, this chapter discusses three syntactic phenomena of Portuguese relevant to the study of LF and PF, as well as to the interfaces between syntax and the other subcomponents of I-language: multiple determiner nominals, ellipsis and pragmatic markers. We will focus on Brazilian Portuguese (BP), but whenever possible, comparisons will be made with other Portuguese varieties.
